moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6: Nothing wrong with Petrov's. It can give good chances to both sides.
moves.3. Nxe5 Bd6: ?! I do not like this move as it prevents his light squared bishop from going anywhere.
moves.4. d4 Nxe4: 5. Nxf7 Kxf7 6. Qh5 Kf8 7. Qf5+ Nf6 fails to regain the material although positionally I have an advantage.
moves.5. Qg4: !? 5. Ng5?? 6. Bxg5 f6 7. Qh5+ g6 (forced. 7. ... Ke7/Kf8 8. Qf7#) 8. Nxg6 fxg5 9. Nxg8+ Ke7/Kf8 10. Qf7#. If 8. ... hxg6 9. Qxh8+ Kf7 10. Qxh7+ and white is up a rook and pawn.
moves.5... Bxe5: I think this is the best reply. Comments welcome!!
moves.6. dxe5 d5: exd e.p. is impossible because of 7. ... Bxg4
moves.7. Qxg7 Rf8 8. Bd3 Bf5 9. O-O: At this point I am okay with developing with only a pawn up because his king is in the middle of the board and I can make his pieces passive.
moves.9... Nc6 10. Nc3 Qd7 11. Bxe4 dxe4 12. B: 12. ... f6 13. exf6 Qxg7 14. fxg7 Rg8 15. Bf6 threatening 16. Nd5.
moves.12... Qe6 13. Bf6: Black is going to have trouble castling now. 13. ... Ne7 14. Rad1
moves.13... a6 14. Rad1 b5 15. Nd5 Rc8: None of black's pieces can move except his bishop!
moves.16. Rfe1 Bg4 17. Rd2 Bh5: I can take my time to improve my position as black has no worthwhile moves to make. Although there was nothing wrong with 18. Rxe4 ...
moves.18. c3 Bg6 19. h3 Na5: ?? Checkmate in 2. See if you can find it.
moves.20. Nxc7+: ! 1-0. 20. ... Rxc7 21. Rd8#. Black must take the knight since he is in check. A nice and short game if you ask me but not particularly climactic.
